name: 2-{[(pyridin-2-ylamino)methyl]amino}naphthalene-1,4-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1906
Reason: 2-Amino-pyridine has a melting point of around 106°C. The pyridine ring itself contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and pi-pi interactions, estimated at around +20°C. The methylamino group introduces a hydrogen bonding potential, which can raise the melting point by approximately +5°C. The naphthalene ring, with its two additional phenyl groups, enhances the crystalline structure and molecular weight, estimated at around +20°C each. The carbonyl group introduces a rigid structure and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5°C.
